job.title: Chief Cybersecurity Research Scientist
job.description: Does a career focused on changing the world's energy future intrigue you? If so, we might have just the opportunity you're looking for!  Idaho National Laboratory (INL) seeks a Chief Cybersecurity Research Scientist for the National & Homeland Security (N&HS) directorate. The primary role of the Chief Cybersecurity Scientist is to advance the scientific and engineering eminence and vitality of the INL, with specific emphasis on the N&HS missions and Lab-wide infrastructure security initiatives.  This position works closely with leadership in cyber mission line organizations including the Cybercore Integration Center, which leads INL's effort to expand government, industry, and university partnerships for cybersecurity with its growing Research & Education Campus. Optional Joint Appointment(s) for research or teaching are available with INL's many national and regional university partners. As the principal initial program leadership responsibility, this position will also provide thought leadership to the Cybersecurity Manufacturing Innovation Institute (CyManII) consortium. CyManII is developing a new Secure Manufacturing Architecture (SMA) and national innovation ecosystem to secure both automation and supply chain to achieve a digital transformation and energy efficiency in U.S manufacturing. CyManII is a national research consortium funded by DOE and led by University of Texas San Antonio (UTSA), with INL as a managing partner, and about 60 leading university and industry partners that collaborate on the creation and execution of a national R&D roadmap to solve the fundamental challenges in cybersecurity for U.S. manufacturing. INL is a science-based, applied engineering national laboratory dedicated to supporting the U.S. Department of Energy’s mission in nuclear energy research, science, and national defense. With more than 5,000 scientists, researchers, and support staff, the laboratory works with national and international governments, universities and industry partners to discover new science and development technologies that underpin the nation’s nuclear and renewable energy, national security, and environmental missions. Our mission is to discover, demonstrate and secure innovative nuclear energy solutions, other clean energy options and critical infrastructure. Our vision is to change the world’s energy future and secure our nation’s critical infrastructure.
